User Story: As a user, I want to create a new character for my selected world so I can have a persona in the narrative.
Acceptance Criteria:
Users can enter a name and description for their character
Users can allocate attribute points according to the world's constraints
Users can select and rate skills based on the world's definitions
Users can provide a background and personality description
The created character is saved and appears in the character list

User Story: As a user, I want to allocate attribute points to customize my character's strengths and weaknesses.
Acceptance Criteria:
Users can distribute a fixed number of attribute points among available attributes
The interface enforces minimum and maximum values for each attribute
The interface shows remaining points as attributes are allocated
Users can reset attribute allocations to start over
Users cannot proceed until all attribute points are allocated

User Story: As a user, I want to select and rate skills that define my character's abilities.
Acceptance Criteria:
Users can select skills from a list defined by the world configuration
Users can assign ratings to selected skills within allowed ranges
The interface enforces any skill selection limits (e.g., maximum number of skills)
Users can remove or change selections before finalizing
Selected skills appear on the character sheet with their ratings

User Story: As a user, I want to write a description and background for my character to establish their identity.
Acceptance Criteria:
Users can enter a physical description of their character
Users can enter personality traits for their character
Users can enter a background story for their character
The interface validates that required fields are completed
Character descriptions are properly formatted and displayed on the character sheet

User Story: As a user, I want to resume character creation if I accidentally navigate away or close the browser.
Acceptance Criteria:
The system automatically saves character creation progress periodically
When returning to character creation, the system detects and offers to restore previous work
Users can choose to continue from saved progress or start fresh
All previously entered data is correctly restored when resuming
The recovery system works across browser sessions

User Story: As a user, I want to view all my created characters so I can select one for play.
Acceptance Criteria:
All characters created by the user are displayed in a list
Each character entry shows basic information (name, world, description)
Characters are loaded from persistent storage when the page loads
The list is responsive and works on different screen sizes
The user can select a character from the list for detailed view or gameplay

User Story: As a user, I want to edit my existing characters to refine their attributes, skills, or descriptions.
Acceptance Criteria:
Users can modify all aspects of an existing character
The system validates changes against the world's constraints
Changes are saved immediately when submitted
The interface provides clear feedback when changes are saved
Users can cancel edits without saving changes

User Story: As a user, I want to delete characters I no longer want to use.
Acceptance Criteria:
Users can initiate character deletion from the character list or detail view
The system requires confirmation before completing deletion
Deleted characters are permanently removed from storage
The interface provides feedback when deletion is complete
The character list updates immediately after deletion

User Story: As a user, I want to select a character to use in my narrative session.
Acceptance Criteria:
The user can select a character from their list of created characters
The selected character is properly loaded into the narrative session
The character selection is persisted between browser sessions
The user interface provides clear feedback when a character is selected
A summary of the selected character is displayed during gameplay, including key derived stats

User Story: As a user, I want to see a summary of my character during gameplay for reference, including key derived stats.
Acceptance Criteria:
Character summary is accessible throughout the gameplay session
Summary displays character name, attributes, skills, and key derived stats
Summary information is presented in a compact, readable format
Character summary is updated if character data changes during gameplay
The summary view is responsive and adapts to different screen sizes
